description: {"blocks":[{"key":"do5su","text":"The advent of genome editing tools like CRISPR/Cas has substantially increased the number of genetically engineered mouse models in recent years. In support of refinement and reduction, sperm cryopreservation is advantageous compared to embryo freezing for archiving and distribution of such mouse models. The in vitro fertilization using cryopreserved sperm from the most widely used C57BL/6 strain has become highly efficient in recent years due to several improvements of the procedure. However, the purchase of the necessary media for routine application of the current protocol poses a constant burden on budgetary constraints. In-house media preparation, instead, is complex and requires quality control of each batch. Here, we describe SEcuRe 2.0, a cost-effective and easily adaptable approach for in vitro fertilization using cryopreserved C57BL/6 sperm. This is mainly achieved by modification of an affordable commercial fertilization medium and a step-by-step description of all other necessary reagents. This protocol is compatible with frozen sperm from all major repositories, and the IVF can easily be adapted to accommodate freshly harvested sperm.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":310,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":806,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hvlp","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evk5v","text":"The basal fertilization medium (Cook's RVF) used in the initial SEcuRe approach has been discontinued by the manufacturer. We have validated HTF as a replacement, and SEcuRe 2.0 successfully employs HTF as the basal fertilization medium ever since. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"684fe","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edp20","text":"(The last step contains a supplemental video with extra context and tips, as part of the protocols.io Spotlight series, featuring conversations with protocol authors.)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"8ottn","text":"ANIMAL PROCEDURES","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ek94f","text":"Sperm of 10- to 20-week-old C57BL/6 males and oocytes of superovulated 3-4-week-old (i.e., 12-14 g body weight) of the corresponding genetic background are collected for the IVF procedures as decribed in published protocols (Behringer, R., et al. Manipulating the mouse embryo: a laboratory manual, Fourth edition. ed. Cold Spring Harbor, New York: Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory Press; 2014.). Females are superovulated with 5 IU of PMSG (Aviva Systems Biology; OPPA01037) followed after 48 hours by 5 IU of hCG (MSD Animal Health; Ovogest 300I.E.). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":240,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqgdo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6v99","text":"We routinely pool the sperm from 2 males to compensate for variability in sperm quality between males, generate sufficient quantities of straws for archiving and distribution, and enable the optional quality control via an IVF of a single straw for each cryopreservation. Use of a single male is possible as well, but the number of straws and volume of media used needs to be reduced by 50%. The integrity of each sperm sample after cryopreservation is recommended to be evaluated by a validation IVF with oocytes from 2 superovulated females. Samples with fertilization rates of \u003e20% can be considered as successfully archived. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"du66u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98jbc","text":"The 2-cell embryo transfer is performed unilaterally according to a published protocol (Behringer, R., et al. Manipulating the mouse embryo: a laboratory manual, Fourth edition. ed. Cold Spring Harbor, New York: Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory Press; 2014.). Well tolerated inhalational anesthetics like isoflurane should be used as anesthetic and carprofen (5 mg/kg BW) Carprosol, CP-Pharma Handels-Gesellschaft mBH) as analgesic after surgery. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":103,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5np7d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1p1eg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8v0n5","text":"MEDIA PREPARATION","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dp1te","text":"Use only embryo-grade reagents.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cl7j7","text":"Use weighing paper and disposable spatulas only.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36anb","text":"For precise volume measurement during c-TYH preparation use a 25 ml volumetric flask (Vitlab; 671941) washed with embryo-grade water before first use and between subsequent steps. related_materials.name: Water (for embryo transfer sterile-filtered BioXtra suitable for mouse embryo cell culture)
FERTIUP Mouse Sperm Preincubation Medium: PM
Falcon¬Æ 60 mm TC-treated Easy-Grip Style Cell Culture Dish
Volumetric flasks Class B transparent 25 ml
Acrodisc¬Æ Syringe Filters with Supor¬Æ Membrane Sterile - 0.2 ¬µm 32 mm
Sealing ball metal for 0.25 ml straws
Falcon¬Æ 35 mm TC-treated Easy-Grip Style Cell Culture Dish

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1t1qe","text":"Prepare 20 straws for 2 sacrificed males of the same line. Use of a single male is possible as well, but the number of straws and volume of media used needs to be reduced by 50%","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"59ho1","text":"Mark the straws at 2.3 cm and 4.0 cm at the open end and label them at the other end (cotton plug)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"76ulu","text":"Attach a 1 ml syringe to the labeled end of the straw and aspirate HTF medium until the meniscus reached the 4.0 cm mark","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9cn0t","text":"Aspirate a 2.3 cm air into the straw and store the assembly until required","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"de7sj","text":"Place a 120 Œºl drop of the gCPA (for preparation see Guidelines \u0026 Warnings) in a 35-mm culture dish, cover it with paraffin oil, add another 120 Œºl of gCPA into the drop to obtain a tall, semi-spherical 240 Œºl drop (for 4 cauda epididymis pooled from 2 males) and prewarm on a 37  ¬∞C hot plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":279,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eaehg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"","guid":"9D5BB8E0B36B11ED83E0013FCD119915","id":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fsfq8","text":"Sacrifice 2 males, collect the cauda epididymides and vasa deferentia in DPBS and clean them of fat and the testicular artery to avoid contaminating the semen with blood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4h824","text":"Dry the cauda epididymides on a tissue (to avoid dilution of gCPA with DPBS), transfer to a 240 ¬µl drop of prewarmed gCPA (on a 37¬†¬∞C hot plate for at least 5 min) and make 6‚Äì7 cuts across the cauda epididymis with a pair of micro spring scissors","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bkmpp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"efg80","text":"Place the dish on a 37¬†¬∞C hot plate for 3 min and gently swirl every min for 20 sec to help the sperm disperse from the tissue","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f88vk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"33hmn","text":"Divide the sperm suspension into 20 aliquots of 10 ¬µl (using a pipette and 200 ¬µl cell-saver tips) on a 10-cm culture dish lid, avoiding carryover of paraffin oil (clean the pipette tip from the outside with a tissue to remove the oil each time before placing a 10 ¬µl aliquot on the dish lid) and any tissue (use microscope) into the aliquots","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e5s18","text":"Aspirate each 10 ¬µl drop into a separate freezing straw followed by 2.3 cm air","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"599ga","text":"Seal the straws (e.g., with a heat sealer or metal balls) and place them in liquid nitrogen gas phase for 10 min. Note: We use a custom-made metal inlay for this purpose but self-made or purchased freezing canisters can be used as well (e.g., http://card.medic.kumamoto-u.ac.jp/card/english/sigen/manual/spfreeze.html#canister or KYD-S018 from Cosmo Bio)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":243,"length":83}],"data":{}},{"key":"7jtv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"42DDB910EA5C11EBB8DE97FD8D9B48CA","url":"http://card.medic.kumamoto-u.ac.jp/card/english/sigen/manual/spfreeze.html#canister"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dkg9r","text":"Transfer the straws to the liquid nitrogen tank for long-term storage","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"allrj","text":"Ideally, the entire IVF procedure (oocyte preincubation, sperm preincubation and fertilization) should be performed in an incubator (5% CO2, 37¬†¬∞C) at 5% O2, but atmospheric O2 concentration have been shown to work well, too","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":138,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":155,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":175,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"931cd","text":"Prepare a 35-cm culture dish (for oocytes from a maximum of 3 females) with a 90 ¬µl drop of HTF+ (for preparation see Guidelines \u0026 Warnings) covered with oil (prewarmed to 37¬†¬∞C) and equilibrate it for at least 20 min in an atmosphere of mixed gas (5% CO2, 5% O2, 37¬†¬∞C)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":95,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":254,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":261,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ccpk","text":"Collect oviducts from superovulated females 15 hours after the hCG injection and clean them in DPBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b3frq","text":"Transfer the oviducts into the paraffin oil next to the 90 Œºl drop of HTF+","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":73,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"33h8h","text":"Release oocyte clutches into the oil by ripping the ampulla with forceps and drag them through the oil into the fertilization drop","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e1t3c","text":"Incubate oocytes for 50 min before adding the sperm suspension (at least 30 min and no longer than 60 min) in an atmosphere of mixed gas (5% CO2, 5% O2, 37¬†¬∞C)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":143,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":150,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d4vvi","text":"Prepare a 35-mm culture dish (for each IVF experiment) with 90 Œºl c-TYH drop (for preparation see Guidelines \u0026 Warnings) covered with paraffin oil and equilibrate it overnight in an atmosphere of mixed gas (5% CO2, 5% O2, 37 ¬∞C)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":212,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":219,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9fa4k","text":"Remove the required straw(s) from long-term storage in liquid nitrogen on the day of IVF, place in a dewar with liquid nitrogen. For thawing, remove the straw(s) from liquid nitrogen, keep it for 5 sec at room temperature and then quickly transfer it into a 37¬†¬∞C water bath for 10 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2k5gv","text":"Dry the straw(s) with a tissue and cut the sealed end and the labeled end of the straw below the cotton plug","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dp6bf","text":"Expel 10Œºl sperm suspension into the center of a 90 Œºl c-TYH drop using a 1 ml syringe","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"43nje","text":"Preincubate for 30 min in an atmosphere of mixed gas (5% CO2, 5% O2, 37¬†¬∞C) before the IVF procedure to allow capacitation of the sperm. Note: Do not disturb the dishes containing the frozen/thawed sperm until the sperm are moving rapidly within the medium. Otherwise, the sperm will not recover full motility ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":59,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":66,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5h12q","text":"Add 10 Œºl of the sperm suspension taken from the edge of the c-TYH drop to the oocyte clutches with the help of a 200 ¬µl cell-saver tip and incubate for 4 hours (at least 3 hours and no longer than 5 hours) in an atmosphere of mixed gas (5% CO2, 5% O2, 37¬†¬∞C)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":243,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":250,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"gveq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a1aop","text":"Add another 10 ¬µl of the sperm suspension to the fertilization medium if the removal of cumulus cells assessed after 20 min of incubation is poor, indicating insufficient motility or concentration of sperm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ajqjh","text":"Wash embryos after the IVF procedure through 10 drops of preincubated embryo culture medium (e.g., M16 or KSOM) and incubate overnight in embryo culture medium in groups of 15‚Äì50 embryos per drop (a 30 ¬µl drop of embryo culture medium covered with paraffin oil) in a CO2 incubator (5% CO2, 37¬†¬∞C, 95% humidity)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":269,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":287,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"erhib","text":"The day after insemination determine fertilization rates (a percentage of the total number of inseminated oocytes that developed to the 2-cell stage)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2geqi","text":"Transfer 2-cell embryos into the oviducts of pseudo-pregnant 0.5 dpc females","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bkhmn","text":"(The following video contains extra context and tips, as part of the protocols.io Spotlight series, featuring conversations with protocol authors.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dqk1r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"av4g7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8dt0p","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"g8rf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"embed","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"code":"\u003ciframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/TDTZKPfThVU\" title=\"YouTube video player\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen\u003e\u003c/iframe\u003e","guid":"E5A576F04FD811ED84B31D4567A8A150"}}}}
